channel.title: Kemal Erdem Blog RSS Feed
channel.description: Even complex things could be explain in a simple way.

item.title: Animal recognition with Siamese Networks and Mean Embeddings
item.description: Is Siamese Network a reliable solution for animal recognition? How Mean Embeddings can help with a few shot "learning"? Are we able to beat standard classification methods?
item.content:encoded:
When hearing about Siamese Networks you probably think about “Face Recognition”. That’s the most common use of those types of networks. We were trying to do sth else, recognize animals based only on top-view camera footage. If you’re not interested…
(This is an article posted to my blog at erdem.pl. You can read it online by clicking here.)

item.title: DengAI - Data preprocessing
item.description: How to preprocess data for the ML competitions? Example based on DengAI.
item.content:encoded:
This article is based on my entry into DengAI competition on the DrivenData platform. I’ve managed to score within 0.2% (14/9069 as on 02 Jun 2020). In this article, I assume that you’re already familiar with DengAI - EDA. You don’t have to read it…
(This is an article posted to my blog at erdem.pl. You can read it online by clicking here.)

item.content:encoded:

item.title: Evolution of Extreme Learning Machines
item.description: How ELMs were evolving through the years and what is their status right now?
item.content:encoded:
Note! This is just a major overview of the ELM evolution. It doesn’t include all possible versions and tweaks done to ELMs through the years. What is ELM? ELM (Extreme Learning Machines) are feedforward neural networks. “Invented” in 2006 by G. Huang…
(This is an article posted to my blog at erdem.pl. You can read it online by clicking here.)

item.title: Finding correlations in time series data
item.description: How to find a correlation between different length of time series vector and predicted result.
item.content:encoded:
Problem description If you’ve ever worked with data analysis it’s highly likely that you know about the idea of data correlation. There are many ways of calculating correlation within your data, and most of them are already implemented in popular…

item.title: Introduction to Extreme Learning Machines
item.description: Not so quick introduction about what is ELM. Is it really an innovation or just an iteration?
item.content:encoded:
What is ELM? ELM (Extreme Learning Machines) are feedforward neural networks. “Invented” in 2006 by G. Huang. As said in the original paper: this algorithm tends to provide good generalization performance at extremely fast learning speed Hence the…

item.title: t-SNE clearly explained
item.description: Dimensionality reduction using T-SNE
item.content:encoded:
What is t-SNE? Many of you already heard about dimensionality reduction algorithms like PCA. One of those algorithms is called t-SNE (t-distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding). It was developed by Laurens van der Maaten and Geoffrey Hinton in 200…
(This is an article posted to my blog at erdem.pl. You can read it online by clicking here.)

item.title: Making TensorflowJS work faster with WebWorkers.
item.description: Improving performance of running Tensorflow models in web applications.
item.content:encoded:
The issue If you’ve ever worked with TensorflowJS you probably know that running data through models (especially image processing) takes a long time. Because JavaScript is single-threaded, that poses a huge problem for a site responsiveness. Every…

item.title: Understanding Region of Interest (RoI Pooling)
item.description: Quick and easy explanation what is RoI Pooling and how it works? Why do we event using it in Fast R-CNNs? Can we use sth better instead?
item.content:encoded:
We’re going to discuss original RoI pooling described in Fast R-CNN paper (light blue rectangle on the image above). There is a second and a third version of that process called RoIAlign and RoIWarp. If you’re interested in those two please check out…

item.title: JSF*ck - Does code weirdness affect execution performance?

item.content:encoded:

item.title: A modern guide to Events in JavaScript
item.description: How Events are propagating through DOM elements? Is there a way to use it to our advantage?
item.content:encoded:
What are Events? Events are objects and implement the Event interface Those objects are dispatched by the user agent (or the application itself) and handled by the Event Listener. Events are responsible for handling user interactions or network…

item.title: V8 function optimization

item.title: Is Symbol really useful?
item.description: Symbols, underestimated feature introduced in ES2015. Does it have any other purpose than interview questions?
item.content:encoded:
Quick recap, what are those “Symbols” anyway? primitive value that represents a unique, non-String Object property key That’s Symbol definition from current spec. But what does it mean? You probably know other primitive types in JS (Undefined, Null…

item.title: How JS becomes multi threaded?
item.description: How we can perform costly operations on our server or user's browser? Multi threading in JavaScript comes to rescue!
